intro: Clidemia ayanagannensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
